item.title: Cloudy with a chance of pie
item.description: Matt Dray The pinnacle of visualisation Great news everyone: I‚Äôve taken the best of two stellar data visualisations and smashed them together into something that can only be described as perfection. Let me set the scene. item.title: Pokeballs in Super Smash Bros
item.description: Matt Dray Smash! Super Smash Bros (SSB) is a beat ‚Äôem up videogame series featuring characters from various Nintendo franchises and beyond. The series has featured on Nintendo 64 (Super Smash Bros, 1998), Gamecube (SSB Melee, 2001), Wii (SSB Brawl, 2008), Wii U and 3DS (SSB ‚Äò4‚Äô, 2014) and an upcoming title for the Switch console. The game is popular enough to have resulted in a series of organised tournaments1.

item.title: Accessibility workshop at #Sprint18
item.description: Matt Dray Sprinting Sprint events are a chance for the government digital, data, design and technology community to: look back on the work we‚Äôve been doing to transform government and to look forward at what we need to do Kevin Cunnington (@kevincunnington), Director General of the Government Digital Service (GDS), outlined this in a recent blog post. This year‚Äôs major themes were transformation, innovation and collaboration. The event was held at the Southbank Centre and Royal Festival Hall in London, with 40 speakers, 19 workshops and over 700 delegates representing 40 departments and agencies.

item.title: TWO DOGS IN TOILET ELDERLY LADY INVOLVED
item.description: Matt Dray TL;DR Animals get stuck in weird places. Oh, and the sf package in R can be used for coordinate reprojection prior to interactive mapping with leaflet. The problem I often work with data that has coordinates; usually a eastings and northings. I need to convert these to latitude and longitude for interactive mapping using the leaflet package in R.

item.title: R Trek: exploring stardates
item.description: Matt Dray Captain‚Äôs log üìñ Star date 71750.51. Our mission is to use R statistical software to extract star dates mentioned in the captain‚Äôs log from the scripts of Star Trek: The Next Generation and observe their progression over the course of the show‚Äôs seven seasons. There appears to be some mismatch in the frequency of digits after the decimal point ‚Äì could this indicate poor abillity to choose random numbers?

item.title: About
item.description: Rostrum: a blog (mostly) about R, statistics and ecology. But also Pokemon and stuff. Us Adriana De Palma Twitter | academia.edu | Google Scholar | NHM I‚Äôm a Postdoctoral Researcher at the Natural History Museum, London. I have a PhD in Ecology and an MRes in Entomology from Imperial College London, and a BSc in Biology from the University of Sussex. In terms of my research, I am particularly interested in using large scale ecological datasets to answer policy relevant questions.
